channel.title: math.OA updates on arXiv.org
channel.description: math.OA updates on the arXiv.org e-print archive.

item.title: An approximate equivalence for the GNS representation of the Haar state of $SU_{q}(2)$
item.description: arXiv:2203.06908v3 Announce Type: replace Abstract: We use the crystallised $C^*$-algebra $C(SU_{q}(2))$ at $q=0$ to obtain a unitary that gives an approximate equivalence involving the GNS representation on the $L^{2}$ space of the Haar state of the quantum $SU(2)$ group and the direct integral of all the infinite dimensional irreducible representations of the $C^{*}$-algebra $C(SU_{q}(2))$ for nonzero values of the parameter $q$. This approximate equivalence gives a $KK$ class via the Cuntz picture in terms of quasihomomorphisms as well as a Fredholm representation of the dual quantum group $\widehat{SU_q(2)}$ with coefficients in a $C^*$-algebra in the sense of Mishchenko.
item.dc:creator: Partha Sarathi Chakraborty, Arup Kumar Pal

item.title: The $\alpha$-induction of Superconformal Nets
item.description: arXiv:2407.01591v2 Announce Type: replace Abstract: The successful application of $\alpha$-induction to the conformal field theory has given rise to many amazing results. For example, the classification of conformal nets in the discrete series. In this paper, however, we study $\alpha$-induction of graded local conformal nets. The main difference lies between locality in the conformal net cases and graded locality in the graded local conformal net cases. We show that the inclusions of graded local conformal nets give braided subfactors. We check that the $\alpha$-induction is still valid in terms of graded local conformal nets. Moreover, the simple current extension originally defined in terms of conformal nets still works for graded local conformal nets. Consequently, we give a shorter proof of classification of $N=2$ superconformal nets in the discrete series according to Gannon's list.
item.dc:creator: Ziyun Xu
